fulltext:
Vu Huong Linh 
Address:          76/74 ngo Van Ung, ngo cho Kham Thien, Hanoi, Vietnam 
Phone:             037-513-2289 
Email:              Linh.vu.huong.vn@gmail.com 
DOB: 
          07/05/1989 
SUMMARY 
N1 Level in Japanese and IELTS 7.5 certificate for English with a Master Degree in Management of 
Cultural Diveristy at Tilburg University (the Netherlands) and 3 years experience working with various 
organizations and industries in Vietnam, Japan and the Netherlands. My career path was designed 
toward the goal of becoming a professional communicator to connect professionals around the globe 
and advance business. I hope the esteemed organization will view my credentials and qualifications as a 
benefit for its endeavours and favourably considers my application as Conference/Meeting Interpreter 
and Business Asssitant.  
 PROFESSIONAL EXPERIENCE 
Sales Executive 
                      June 2017 – Present 
Softbank Telecom Vietnam 
 
Researching organizations and individuals online (via SNS) to identify new leads and 
potential new customers in Japanese market. 
 
Contacting potential clients via email and phone to make appointment and establish rapport. 
 
Meeting clients to negotiate and close sales deal. Crafting contracts, tracking orders and 
maintenance services. 
Freelance interpreter/ translator                                                                                          Sept 2015 – Feb 2016 
 
GameStad Co., Ltd: Supported GameStad and Dutch entrepreneur to prepare documents, join 
meeting and present at Tokyo Game Show 2015. Translated manuals and guides to introduce 
the company to Japanese clients and customers. 
 
Assistant for Japanese Art Gallery in Bussum, the NL: assisted Mrs. Uchitani in opening a new 
gallery and making lesson plans to Dutch members and English-speaking customers. 
Japanese Communicator   
       Oct 2012 – Jun 2014 
Vietsoftware International(VSII) , Hanoi, Vietnam (http://www.vsi-international.com/)  
 
Supported Business Manager and Project Team Leader as a business support and project 
coordinator. 
 
Interpreted meetings between Japanese customers and Vietnamese Engineering team. Translated 
documents from Japanese to Vietnamese and vice versa. 
 
Got promoted to Onsite project lead communicator after 2 months of employment. Orchestrated 
communication and assisted administrative tasks of onsite and offsite project teams.  
 
Resolved inquiries and conflicts via phone, emails, Skype and direct meetings and delivered projects 
under pressure with top customer satisfaction rate from 80% to 90% on average. 
Page 1 of 2 
 
Coordinated marketing campaigns for the Japanese market by proposing and delivering monthly 
segmented emails with dynamic contents, and internal newsletters to investors and business 
partners.  
ACTIVITIES 
Event planner and team leader at Vietnam National University (VNU) Youth Union  
     Sept 2007 – Jun 2012 
 
Collaborated with NGO groups to organize independent talks, seminars and workshops monthly. 
 
Directed and maneuvered Flash Mob event to promote LGBT rights with other universities. 
 
Enthusiastically supported the opening of the first English club and coached the team to score Second 
Place in Language Competition for Non-major Universities in 2012.  
 
Certified for exceptional contribution for Student Community in 2011-2012 and outstanding team 
leader by the President of Vietnam Coordination UNDV at International Vesak Day 2008.                        
EDUCATION 
Tilburg University, the Netherlands 
    April 2016 – Jun 2016 
Certification: Economics for International Students 
Tilburg University, the Netherlands 
      Aug 2014 – Oct 2015 
Master of Cultural Diversity Management 
 
Academic Excellence Scholarship for Non-EU students 
 
Organizational communication management, cultural training and data analysis. 
Tokyo University, Japan 
      Oct 2010 – Aug 2011 
 
Associate degree of Arts (Japanese Studies) – Exchanged short-term program 
University of Social Sciences and Humanities, Vietnam 
     Sept 2007 – Jun 2012 
Bachelor of Oriental Studies (Japanese Studies) 
 
First place at Vietnam National University’s Research Contest and received Honor Scholarship.  
SKILLS 
Language 
Fluent in English (IELTS 7.5) and Japanese (JLPT N1) 
Computer 
MS Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook), Social media (Twitter, Facebook, 
Instagram, Pinterest and LinkedIn). 
OTHERS 
Hobbies 
Running and reading books. 
Page 2 of 2

Contacting potential clients via email and phone to make appointment and establish rapport.
Meeting clients to negotiate and close sales deal. Crafting contracts, tracking orders and maintenance services.

: Supported GameStad and Dutch entrepreneur to prepare documents, join meeting and present at Tokyo Game Show 2015. Translated manuals and guides to introduce the company to Japanese clients and customers.

Interpreted meetings between Japanese customers and Vietnamese Engineering team. Translated documents from Japanese to Vietnamese and vice versa.
Got promoted to Onsite project lead communicator after 2 months of employment. Orchestrated communication and assisted administrative tasks of onsite and offsite project teams.

Coordinated marketing campaigns for the Japanese market by proposing and delivering monthly segmented emails with dynamic contents, and internal newsletters to investors and business partners.
